result.execSummary:
The defendant Norman E Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Forgery (Alteration, etc.), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(4)(a).
  • Credit Card-Forgery (Alteration, etc.), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(4)(a).
  • Credit Card-Forgery (Alteration, etc.), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(4)(a).
  • Credit Card-Forgery (Alteration, etc.), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(4)(a).
  • Credit Card-Forgery (Alteration, etc.), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(4)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber granted for work in Illinois or for work search in Racine.
Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. Do not go into any bars or liquor stores.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Do not drive unless properly licensed and must get approval from agent. Establish paternity for minor children and comply with any family court orders. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Probation can be transfered to Illinois. Any assessments, counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
